# Session Overview

This 2-hour microlearning session introduces Typst, a modern markup-based typesetting system designed as a more user-friendly alternative to LaTeX. Typst offers a simpler syntax, faster compilation times, and a more intuitive approach to document creation while still producing beautifully typeset documents with support for mathematics, references, and bibliographies. Whether you're new to typesetting or looking to transition from LaTeX, this session will give you the essential skills to get started with Typst.

## What You'll Learn

- Set up and use Typst (local installation and online options)
- Understand Typst's markup syntax and document structure
- Create structured documents with proper formatting
- Include mathematical equations and formulas
- Add figures, tables, and cross-references
- Manage citations and bibliographies
- Create custom styles and templates

# Session Curriculum

## Part 1: Getting Started with Typst (30 minutes)

- Introduction to Typst and its advantages
- Setting up Typst (installation options and online editor)
- Document structure and basic markup
- Content blocks vs. code blocks
- Creating a simple document
- Instant preview and compilation

## Part 2: Essential Typst Features (40 minutes)

- Text formatting and styling
- Mathematical notation and equations
- Creating lists, tables, and figures
- Cross-referencing within documents
- Page layout and document organization
- Working with headings and sections
- Generating a table of contents

## Part 3: Advanced Document Elements (40 minutes)

- Creating custom styles and templates
- Managing citations with bibliographies
- Advanced mathematics formatting
- Creating custom functions
- Page numbering and headers/footers
- Controlling page breaks and layout
- Exporting to PDF and other formats

## Part 4: Tips and Best Practices (10 minutes)

- Typst vs. LaTeX - when to use each
- Common issues and how to resolve them
- Performance optimization tips
- Resources for continued learning
- The Typst community and package ecosystem

# Learning Outcomes

By the end of this microlearning session, you will be able to:

- Set up a working Typst environment
- Create structured documents with proper formatting
- Include mathematical equations, figures, tables, and citations
- Apply custom styles to your documents
- Compile your documents to professional-looking PDFs
- Understand the advantages and limitations of Typst compared to LaTeX
- Know where to find help and resources for advanced Typst features

# Teaching Methods

This session combines:

- Live demonstrations
- Hands-on exercises
- Template-based learning
- Comparative examples (LaTeX vs. Typst)
- Problem-solving challenges

# Target Audience

This microlearning session is ideal for:

- Students and researchers who need to create academic documents
- Professionals who work with technical documentation
- LaTeX users looking for a more modern alternative
- Anyone who wants to create professionally formatted documents
- People who find LaTeX too complex or time-consuming

# Prerequisites

- Basic computer skills
- No prior typesetting experience required
- LaTeX experience is helpful but not necessary
- Bring your laptop with internet access

# Materials

All participants will receive:

- Typst cheat sheet with key syntax and commands
- Sample templates for various document types
- Comparison guide between LaTeX and Typst
- Bibliography management examples
- List of recommended Typst packages and resources
